boardgame.name: Guide to Varisia (Pathfinder for Savage Worlds)
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Those who head north from Magnimar along the rocky coastline quickly find themselves in a peculiar country. Fog drapes the rolling landscape, floating spectrally along damp and lonely moors. Small woodlands grace the region, their tangled depths redolent of nettles and pepperwood and pine sap, further inland, river valleys lined by majestic redwoods wind between ragged tors and limestone escarpments. The region’s vastness and sense of isolation have earned it its local name—the Lost Coast.

boardgame.name: Second Thoughts
boardgame.description:
Each team is given a word slate, a timer, and a marker. The teams choose their pawn that they will use throughout the course of the game. The board is placed in the center of the teams, and the pawns are placed on the beginning portion of the board.

The five, multi-colored die are rolled. It is up to the group as to who rolls them. The letters on each die are written into the corresponding square on the word slate. Simply match the colors!

The sand timers are then flipped, signifying the lack of time each team has to come up with words that fit the letters and spacing on the word slate. The goal is for each team to come up with five words, one using each letter. After the timers run out, each team must stop, even if they have not reached five words.

The teams now switch boards. The timer is flipped again! One player on the team will have the board, while the other player does not know what the words on the board are. The reader must then play a rushed game of charades, attempting to help their teammate guess the words!

They cannot say, or mouth, the words, but they can give hints and attempt a fun guessing game! The team with the most words guessed, or who finish first, get to move their pawn up one spot on the game board! They are one step closer to being declared the winners!

boardgame.name: Hollow's Last Hope (SP)
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

The town of Falcon's Hollow needs a miracle.

A plague has come to the town of Falcon’s Hollow, and not even the town’s priest can abate its wretched course. With the coughs of the sick and the wails of the dying echoing through town, the local herbalist uncovers a cure, but she needs some brave heroes to retrieve the ingredients. Finding the cure means risking the dangerous Darkmoon Vale, infiltrating a witch’s haunted hut, and delving the ruins of an abandoned dwarven monastery.

Hollow’s Last Hope is a wilderness exploration and dungeon adventure for Novice Rank characters, designed for play with Pathfinder for Savage Worlds.

This adventure includes details on the haunted forest and deadly ruins that hide the key ingredients to the town’s salvation. Do your heroes have the skill and courage to find the cure in time?

boardgame.name: Forbidden Hero
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Solo role playing Forbidden Lands

This booklet provides a toolbox for playing Forbidden Lands as a single-player game, without a Game Master.

boardgame.name: Patchwork's Pit
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mini-Dungeon for 5 characters of level 1

The game seems harmless enough: the first team to collect three chickens from the bottom of a steep-walled pit is declared the winner. But Patchwork Mabel—the mysterious figure who runs the contest—is a night hag in disguise. And the peck of Mabel’s “chickens” turns flesh to stone…

Patchwork’s Pit is an introductory adventure designed to start a new campaign. Characters who know each other prior to the adventure might be hired to track down a competitor who failed to return from Patchwork’s Pit. Alternatively, the characters might meet for the first time at the pit. In this case, Mabel groups the characters into a team as the adventure begins.

boardgame.name: Death Rising
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An amazing adventure for the 5th Edition of the world's most popular roleplaying game, for 11-12th level characters (but easily altered to fit almost any level)!

In the ancient desert kingdom of Ishia (think Ancient Egypt), the loyal undead servants are suddenly attacking their living masters after years of faithful service. And long dead pharaohs have reawakened in their crypts, waging war on each other to claim Ishia and the world. To make matters worse, powerful factions are maneuvering to turn these disasters to their advantage. Are these events related? It’s up to some brave adventurers to unravel this mystery, ally with a faction, and face down the Mummy Lords… or serve them.

Focused on combat, exploration, and roleplaying in equal measure, Death Rising will provide lots of hours of fun as players solve puzzles, answer riddles, meet fascinating NPCs, face down dangerous traps, and defeat deadly opponents on their way to victory or death in the shifting sands!

Features:

135 pages, 3 chapters and an illustrated appendix, plus a handy summary of all NPCs in the adventure
Three faction paths that will change the outcome of the adventure based on player choices
A very compelling main quest and 10 exciting side quests
5 large dungeons that fit with the adventure but are usable separately, perfect for one-shot sessions
29 maps, formatted separately for Roll20, Fantasy Grounds, Astral, and Foundry! Grids will line up perfectly with your favorite VTT! Worth it for the maps alone
All maps also provided in large size 300 dpi for printing and playing on your tabletop
Fully linked, bookmarked, and layered PDF, with every monster and NPC linked to either the 5e SRD or the location in the appendix
Original new monsters
Designed to easily pick up and play at the table

boardgame.name: Trek 12: Zen Trek
boardgame.description:
Trek 12 Zen Trek is an official print and play mini-expansion, offered by the publisher in may 2021.

It consist in a new player board. To access the zenitude you will have to travel a very special route, passing through the river separating the two valleys and reaching the other side without using artifices. You will have to immerse yourself completely in the water without the help of ropes and come out of this journey grown !

boardgame.name: Breach: Escape the Space Station
boardgame.description:
Life on a space station can be an exhilarating experience. That can all change in an instant when things go awry.

You are part of the space station's crew when all heck breaks loose. With limited access to supplies and weapons your only hope is to make it to the escape pods. Unfortunately, the way there is riddled with blocked passages and invaders looking to destroy you. Finding the escape pod access areas is your only hope!

As the crew, you must run the corridors, gather supplies, and locate the escape pods while fighting off the invaders. It is your choice how you play. Do you all work together, is it an all out fight to escape, or do you use your fellow crew to find the pods and then abandon them.

Players roll to move through the station, discovering new sections and paths, items to use and encounters to battle or avoid.

Game ends when 1 player reaches an escape pod, all do, or the station is destroyed. Depends on how the players choose to setup the game.

boardgame.name: Komplize gesucht!
boardgame.description:
Who would you rob a bank with? Who would be the right partner for a small betting fraud? And who would you choose to get the pesky nightclub bouncer out of the way?

The world is full of criminal challenges, and there are plenty of prominent candidates for your next coup: politicians, artists, athletes, actors, scholars, musicians. In Komplize gesucht!, you get to name who your accomplices would be for these crimes and more.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: 箱館戦争ソリティア (Hakodate Sensou Solitaire)
boardgame.description:
The Battle of Hakodate was a war in which the first maritime strategy faced by modern Japan dominated the battlefield. The Kaiyo was lost in an accident, and the new government army acquired the ironclad Kotetsu, and the power balance changed drastically.

The player aims to establish the Republic of Ezo from the standpoint of Takeaki Enomoto. The operation of the Navy is important, but money is needed for the Navy to function. Taxes must be collected while paying attention to the feelings of the residents, and ground troops and warships must be prepared to prepare for the arrival of the new government army. Can you fight better than historically against the new government forces who are trying to end the civil war early with the game system? Or can we achieve the long-cherished desire to establish the Republic of Ezo?

Published in Banzai EX Magazine No.9


箱館戦争は近代日本が直面した最初の海洋戦略が戦局を左右する戦争でした──当時国内最強の軍艦〈開陽〉を要する旧幕府軍が海軍力で新政府軍を圧倒していましたが、その〈開陽〉を事故で失い、新政府軍が装甲艦〈甲鉄〉を手に入れ、パワー・バランスは激変しました。プレイヤーは榎本武揚の立場で蝦夷共和国の樹立を目指します。海軍の運用が重要ですが、海軍を機能させるためには金が必要です。住民感情に注意しつつ徴税し、地上部隊と軍艦を整備して、新政府軍の来寇に備えなければなりません。果たしてあなたは、ゲーム・システムによって内戦を早期に終わらせようとする新政府軍を相手に、史実より善戦できるでしょうか。あるいは、蝦夷共和国樹立の悲願を達成できるでしょうか。

Components:
Map: 1 A3 size
Counter: 99 pieces of 15 mm square (including the following variants for "Hakodate Sensou" and "Red Crescent White Cross (First Balkan War Variant in "Red Sun Blue Cross")
Rulebook: A4 size 12 pages
Player assistance card: 1 A4 size
boardgame.boardgamefamily: History: Boshin War & Meiji Era Rebellions

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Devolution: Become a Supreme Leader for Life!
boardgame.description:
Devolution is a game about the dark nature of politics, where you will attempt to take control of the Judiciary, Media and Strategic Companies to gain the absolute power over the Republic and become the Supreme-Leader-For-Life! (Just a heads up though, life may be short and death unnatural).

To do that, you will need to gain popularity points by bribing or manipulating the voters. It comes at a cost of increasing depravity of public life and so the doomsday clock is set in motion! If you don't seize power before it reaches 100, the people will storm the palace gates and hang everyone.

The increasing depravity may not be all bad news. When the Depravity Meter reaches 70 there will be an opportunity for one of you to seize power as the leader of the revolutionary movement that will soon swallow everyone. Players can also seize power with the generals in a Coup d'État or with Priesthood or with Business.

winning conditions depend on the number of players


Each player holds seven cards and plays 2 per turn. These and popularity can be used to buy cards from the Republic deck or to spite and stop the other players which raises the depravity which, as Depravity Meter reaches 70, gives one more opportunity, for those holding the Spirit of the Revolution card, to seize power as the leader of the people. There is a variety of cards in the deck, some can be used out of turn in reaction to another player’s play adding more dynamic interaction to the game (you can foil someone else’s plan by assassinating the Judge they needed to gain an Judiciary Institution with a Black Ops card, for example).

Like in politics, the effects of one’s actions are not always 100% predicable: dice rolls) and as the Depravity Meter goes up past bomb-marked fields, the player causing the depravity has to draw a card from the Shit Happens deck which may adversely affect just them or everybody at the table (the logic being that the misdeeds withing the party affect the image of the whole party). Players draw cards at the end of their turn.

boardgame.name: Heckin Hounds
boardgame.description:
Heckin Hounds is a 2-7 player trick-taking game exploring the perils of professional dog walking in the Underworld.

Players are given the task of walking Hades' collection of hounds. Do your job too well, and she'll promote you to management - a responsibility feared throughout the realm. Do your job too poorly, and you'll be demoted to professional dog food instead.

The game is played with your hand facing outward, giving you no knowledge of the hounds you have. Every round has a different player serving as the shift leader, who can see both their hand and everyone else’s. The shift leader gives each player three clues as to the hounds they are holding - how helpful, useless, or beguiling the clue is up to you, but they must be true. The shift leader also assigns Cerberus to a player, a trump card pup that wins any trick he shows up to.

Players have a few opportunities to try and manage their luck, and must promise how many shifts they will work (tricks they will take) based on the limited information they have of their own hand, and the hands of the other players they can see. Cards are played, tricks are won, and a new round begins. After everyone has taken a turn as the shift leader, the game is over. The player who scored the least without going negative did the least amount of work without being fired, and wins the game!

Thus, Heckin Hounds is a game of being barely adequate.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Sotavento Campaign: Resistance and Counterguerrilla in Veracruz, 1863-1865
boardgame.description:
To Mexico, the decade of the 1860s led to a convulsed period characterized by the despotic government of Antonio Lopez de Santa Anna as well a devastating civil war, called “The War of the Three Years”, tollowing "The Mexican Adventure" or The second French intervention in Mexico.

The game begins right after the battles of May 5th in Puebla and the action of Cerro del Borrego in Orizaba,
and continues throughout the campaign in Veracruz, until the withdrawal of French expeditionary troops in 1866.

The French player needs to ensure a line of supplies for his troops, establish garrisons as well as conduct operations to
locate and neutralize the Mexican resistance strongholds and encampments. The Republican player (Mexican side) needs to recruit forces within the local population, establish military training camps, carry out ambushes and disrupt the French communication lines as much as possible.

The security of this route became an issue of strategic importance for the circulation of war supplies and of the different military forces that would march inland; patrolling and keeping it open was a task for different special units, like the Sudanese Regiment and the Foreign Legion.

The Guerrilla war would begin, led by veteran officers: Their mission was to maintain a war of attrition, all the time and in the most effective ways possible; a state of harassment for the French invasion and their Mexican allies.
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2021 Zenobia Award Historian's Choice Honorable Mention

boardgame.name: Claim: Reinforcements – Sun
boardgame.description:
The enormous effect of the sun on the realm has been recognized since the dawn of time and it is by far the most
important source of energy for life. The sun worshippers have always been neutral. Until now… They are fierce, heroic and
strong. With the sunlight at their back they will be unstoppable.

Note: This is an expansion. You need CLAIM or CLAIM2 to play the game.

listing.notes: Game weight: 0.150 kg
Title: Claim: Reinforcements – Sun Publisher: White Goblin Games Language(s): English Dutch

boardgame.name: 101: le match
boardgame.description:
A small game of picking tiles.

You will have to do a 5x5 board with number from 1 to 10 in 5 colors.

But before pickup you only see the back of the tile, who only shows to you, a choice between 2 colors, and 5 numbers. The more the game advance, the more the guessing is easy.

In each line and column, you will be compared to opponent at the the end of the game, scoring combinations are like in poker. But only the better of both will score the line/column!

The game ends when all tiles are all used. The winner is the player with the best score.

boardgame.name: Once upon a time in Ongolloro
boardgame.description:
Un’avventura narrativa ambientata in un paesino di lago nel 1928. I protagonisti sono tre bimbe e un bimbo di 10 anni, nati alla fine della prima guerra mondiale.

L'avventura è una one-shot di circa 3 ore (riassunto della versione originale, lunga circa il doppio) e può essere giocata con le regole di diversi giochi di ruolo.

La trama è liberamente ispirata alle storie e leggende della città di Anguillara Sabazia, e dei suoi laghi Bracciano e Martignano.

boardgame.name: Spirits of the Forest: Wishes and Hexes
boardgame.description:
This small expansion introduces more ways to play by having missions to complete for extra points. The bundle includes 12 wishes and 8 hexes cards.

This is included in the Spirits of the Forest: Retail Expansion Pack (https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgameexpansion/269136/spirits-...)
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Spirits of the Forest: Solar Terms Cards

boardgame.name: The Scroll (Issue 3 - Winter 1990-91)
boardgame.description:
Cover byline:
The Magazine for the Dedicated Gamer

boardgame.name: Metro X: Expansion – Taipei / Kuala Lumpur
boardgame.description:
The Rail and Write Game.

X marks the stops! Flip a card, choose a subway line, and cross off the given number of stops on your map. Earn bonuses for making transfers, but lose points for incomplete tracks. Everyone plays at the same time, so there's never a dull moment as you race to complete routes. Get the highest score and become an underground sensation!

These two new subway maps, Taipei and Kuala Lumpur, offer new challenges to this great game! Can you conquer them?

boardgame.name: Inuyasha: Kagome no Sengoku Nikki
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Inuyasha: Kagome no Sengoku Nikki is the second InuYasha game, released in Japan in 2001.

boardgame.name: Inuyasha: Kagome no Yume Nikki
boardgame.description:
User Summary

InuYasha: Kagome no Yume Nikki is a game in the InuYasha universe, a sequel to Kagome no Sengoku Nikki.

boardgame.name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game (Second Edition) – Valyrian Draft Starter
boardgame.description:
Experience the power struggles, terrifying battles, and subtle intrigues of A Game of Thrones: The Card Game with an entirely new format: draft. By combining fixed Valyrian Draft Starters with algorithmically randomized Valyrian Draft Packs, you and up to seven of your friends can carefully draw together a variety of cards to create a deck and pursue victory. To experience the game of thrones in an entirely new and unpredictable way and play with some of the cards from the War of Five Kings cycle before anyone else, there’s no better option than to start a draft.

A Valyrian Draft Starter includes an assortment of general cards, including economy, plots, and agendas that can form the basis for any draft deck.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: A Game of Thrones – The Card Game (LCG)

boardgame.name: Tajna faraona
boardgame.description:
A fun board game Secrets of the Pharaohs. Learn hieroglyphs and have fun discovering the secrets of the pharaohs.

On board place tiles face down tile side is with alphabet letters and face up with hieroglyphs. There is reference what letter is with which hieroglyphs, but game encouraged to remember pairs as players can only see side with hieroglyphs.

2 to 4 players starts from middle of board. Rolling a die and move by exact rolled number. Goal is to collect letters and form word with 3 or up to 6 letters, and it's scored accordingly.
First player to score 20+ points win.



"Zabavna društvena igra Tajne faraona. Naučite hijeroglife i ludo se zabavljajte otkrivajući tajne faraona".
Opis dizajnera.

boardgame.name: Rising Star Football
boardgame.description:
Rising Star Football Edition, the board game of dreams, where you have the chance to play out a footballer's career of your own. Compete against your opponents to earn points, money and fame all in the hope of having the greatest career and becoming Rising Star champion!

This sports based role-playing game allows individuals to play out a footballer's career. They compete in matches, have contracts and sponsorships, work with an agent and take part in different events.

Matches use the match dice to decide the scores and players roll against each other. Match Event cards can be used to impact the final score. Contracts allow the players to earn money and they can change contracts by being transferred or entering negotiations where their agent's ability (if they have one) comes into play.

With varied tiles that require different actions and lots of cards to read aloud this game brings all the components of a footballer's life into a board game and gives a fun competitive environment for friends and families to play.

Players roll the game dice to move around the board. Depending on where they land, different events occur. They could land on a variety of match event tiles where they have to play out a match against an opponent in the hope of defeating them and gaining points. They could appear in the press and draw a press card to read what the papers are saying about them, impacting their fame. They might enter contract negotiations and use their Agent's ability to enhance the amount of contracts they are offered. There are many different events that occur as the player goes through each season and this can change the storyline of that player as well as impact their career in positive and negative ways.

The length of game varies depending on how many seasons players wish to play. This is decided at the start of the game and one trip around the board is equal to one season. The game ends when all players have completed the agreed upon number of seasons.

Throughout each player's career their goal is to collect Points (won by participating in Matchdays, Reserves, Derby Day and Cup Final events), earn money by improving their contract, gaining sponsorships and getting transferred and gain fame by appearing in the press. The referee keeps track of the scores and the winner is the player with the highest career score. The scoresheet has a simple formula for calculating the winner at the end of the game and the results are announced in reverse order crowning the winner Rising Star Champion.

boardgame.name: Aurora
boardgame.description:
The Struggle for Dominance over Space Sector Control.

At start players receive game money which is used to buy buildings represented by tokens and soldiers standees. Before battle in turn sequence starts players can use start money to make their beginning camp and units.

Players also received a mission which by completing it brings player more money for purchasing more soldiers and more buildings.
Every building and every soldier have their own special abilities and unique movement and fire power and range. On players turn, any time during a turn player may buy new units as well as new buildings.

Buildings may be place anywhere on board but units must be placed in headquarters. Forget to say that during setup headquarters must be built. It is suggested to protect HQ with building and units also during setup.

Player then on same turn may activate any and all soldiers standee with up to two actions like move, fire or special actions.
Also any time mission conditions are met, reveal it, take reward and draw new mission card (keep it secret from other player).
Game and triggers in two ways. First by defeating enemy HQ and surviving player takes win. Second way is when one player no longer have money to buy new units and have no units/soldiers in play. That player lose.



Borba za prevlast nad kontrolom sektora svemira.

boardgame.name: Munch adventure
boardgame.description:
Eat munch, make a figurine and be the first to explore the universe and win.

Board with spaces from start to finish. In turns players roll die and move with their figure by the rolled number. All spaces triggers affect and follow instruction what to do next.
First player to reach finish is winner.

Also company behind game introduce idea to use their Munch cookie.
"Open a pack, grab a Munch, use stretch foil to make your unique figure and win. Winner takes rest of cookies from the pack as reward."



"Pojedi munch, napravi figuricu i prvi istraži svemir i pobedi".
Opis dizajnera.

boardgame.name: Evergreen Forest (fan expansion to Carcassonne)
boardgame.description:
The woodsmen working within the forests around Carcassonne have formed a guild to share information regarding the best spots to harvest woodland produce. However, the main goal of the guild is to ensure that the forests around Carcassonne remain forever evergreen, guaranteeing the livelihood of the woodsmen for generations to come.

Four new icons for the Forests:
Cherry: to have a double turn
Chivarly: to upgrade your follower
Woodsman Guild: like the pennants for the cities

boardgame.name: Arcana of Love: Sensual Deck
Arcana of Love: Sinnliches Deck
Arkana miłości: Talia romantyczna
boardgame.description:
The Sensual deck helps players overcome shyness and introduces variety into the bedroom. Your romantic life will be even more exciting and full of passion.

This deck is delicate and sensual — a perfect way to get to know each other better, open up, and spend a wonderful evening together, leading to pleasure for both of you.

The deck contains 55 cards with various tasks, challenges and undressing cards, which may be freely mixed with the Passionate and Spicy deck. Each card is illustrated using fine erotic photography and inspirational quotes.

The game ends when one of the players (the game was designed for an unlimited number of players, but of course it will be played mostly by couples) is naked and an "arcana" card is played. That player loses the game.

NOTE: It's a reimplementation of Arkana Miłości. Not only the graphics changed, but also a lot of cards were added/removed/changed.

boardgame.name: Arcana of Love: Leidenschaftliches Deck
Arcana of Love: Passionate Deck
Arkana miłości: Talia namiętna
boardgame.description:
The Passionate deck is the best way to raise the temperature in your bedroom. With this deck you can open up new experiences and strengthen the bond with your partner by surrendering to avid caresses.

This deck is intense and full of passion, allowing you to focus on various senses and improve sensations during foreplay.

The deck contains 55 cards with various tasks, challenges and undressing cards, which may be freely mixed with the Passionate and Spicy decks. Each card is embellished with fine erotic photography and inspirational quotes.

The game ends when one of the players (the game was designed for an unlimited number of players, but of course it will be played mostly by couples) is naked and an "arcana" card is played. That player loses the game.

NOTE: It's a reimplementation of Arkana Miłości: Kochankowie, which was previously a 24 card expansion. Not only the graphics changed, but also a lot of cards were added/removed/changed.

boardgame.name: Bedeville Carnival
boardgame.description:
Over the years, a lively town has fallen into ruin. Disturbing stories that surround Bedeville can send shivers down your spine. One of them, often considered the most real, tells a tale of Mr. Carl - a grave keeper and a grim owner of a local theme park.

Mr. Carl arrived in Bedeville back when life and happiness bloomed in every corner of this little town. As a juggler and later - grave digger in a nearby graveyard, he barely made the ends meet. How did he get the fortune that let him create a theme park? We will probably never learn. Some think that he made a pact with a malignant, and fun-loving Trickster. That’s the only explanation for what happened next, including the nightmare, that led Bedeville to its downfall. Citizens were forced to leave this grim place while Mr. Carl ended up doomed to eternal torment. What kind of torment? Having his theme park be visited by “unique” guests like the undead from the nearby graveyard. Additionally, to make Mr. Carl even angrier, they’re invited every night by the ticket seller, who opens the grounds of Bedeville Carnival when dusk arrives.

This is where your adventure begins. As corpses from the nearby graveyard, you will visit the crazy attractions of the theme park. It doesn’t matter when and how you ended up in this burial ground. Each night an eerie force makes you wake up from the eternal slumber and feel alive again. Each night you will discover new attractions and collect Souvenirs before they’ll get grabbed by grave digger’s mean cat called Fleabag. But beware! Mr. Carl can catch you anytime and chase you back to the cemetery.

The game is played in consecutive player turns. Each player has the goal of collecting the most Joy Markers and Souvenirs sold in the local Booths. When all Souvenirs end up being sold to the players - the game concludes. The player, who at the end has the most victory points awarded for their Joy Markers and Souvenirs collected, becomes the winner.

Every Player picks their favorite undead unafraid of any, even the most dangerous Attractions. Next, you draw the crazy Attractions that the characters will move through during the game. By visiting more and more Attractions and performing Actions from the Attractions you will attempt to outsmart your graveyard friends. By using Actions in a smart way a Player will attempt to hold their position on a specific Attraction. Only this way they will be able to buy Souvenirs next turn. At the end of each turn, a player draws one Trickster’s token from the bag and checks what destiny has for them in-store. Attractions generate Noise Markers. The more Noise, the bigger the chance that the Attractions will make the grave keeper arrive and chase the player’s character back to the graveyard.

boardgame.name: Arcana of Love: Scharfes Deck
Arcana of Love: Spicy Deck
Arkana miłości: Talia pikantna
boardgame.description:
The Spicy Deck is best for those looking for intense experiences, helping you fulfill fantasies related to possessive domination and arousing submission, also by using sensual gadgets. This game fires up hidden passions and desires.

This deck is ideal for those who wish to feel in total control, empowered or dominated, and who wish to fulfill more specific and refined fantasies.

The deck contains 55 cards with various tasks, challenges and undressing cards, which may be freely mixed with the Passionate and Spicy decks. Each card is embellished with fine erotic photography and inspirational quotes.

The game ends when one of the players (the game was designed for an unlimited number of players, but of course it will be played mostly by couples) is naked and an "arcana" card is played. That player loses the game.

NOTE: It's a reimplementation of Arkana Miłości: Dominacja. Not only the graphics changed, but also a lot of cards were added/removed/changed.

boardgame.name: Tajni agent Izzy
boardgame.description:
Izzy's task is to keep order and peace in the city and keep his true love Laura from the evil rat Grim De Vit and his helper, the dog Hector, who manage to kidnap her again. The two have help from their naughty followers, the crow Cana and the alligator Gagaligator. Izzy is helped by: the boss, who tells him the news about the movement of the villains, the doe Aida, who loves opera singing, and the canary Ogi, who is there to help with the magic ball".

Game inspired by TV video game of the same name run from 2002 to 2009. Using a board with road from start to finish where one of our agents in game save hostage from villain.
Game use two type of dice. One is for movement from 1 to 5 and special symbol which triggers use of second die.
Second die have depicted vehicles or magical item which allows agents to use special shortcut useable only for that kind of vehicle/item.
First one to reach finish is the winner i.e. their agent defeat a villain and rescue hostage. That is game end.



Задатак Изија је да води рачуна о реду и миру у граду и чува своју љубав Лору, од злог пацова Грим Де Вита и његовог помоћника, пса Хектора, који изнова успевају да је киднапују. Њих двојица имају помоћ од стране својих неваљалих следбеника, вране Цане и алигатора Гагалигатора. Изију помоћ пружају: шеф, који му саопштава вести о кретању негативаца, мишица Аида, која воли оперско певање и канаринац Оги, који је ту да помогне са чаробним клупком.

boardgame.name: Gravwell: 2nd Edition
boardgame.description:
In Gravwell, players command spaceships that have been pulled through a black hole, transporting them into a different dimension. With each ship lacking fuel to get home, each player must collect basic elements from surrounding asteroids, using the gravity of the dimension and what little resources they have in order to reach the warp gate that will take them home. But in this dimension, moving ships will travel towards the nearest object, which is usually another ship, and when those objects are moving either forward or backward, reaching the warp gate isn't always easy. Time is running out to save your crew and your ship! As a grim reminder of the cost of failing to escape, the frozen hulks of dead spacecraft litter the escape route — but with careful card play, you can slingshot past these derelict craft and be the first to escape from the Gravwell!

Gravwell uses 26 alphabetized cards to determine movement order and thrust; most cards move your ship towards the nearest object, but a few move you away from it. At the start of each round, players draft fuel cards, picking up three pairs of two cards, with only the top card of each pile being visible; you get some information as to which moves you can expect from the other spaceships, but you won't know which moves you'll be forced to make when you draft your cards!

During a round, each player will play all of their fuel cards in the order of their choosing. During each phase of a round, each player chooses one card, then all cards are revealed and resolved in alphabetical order. When your opponents move in ways you didn't expect, you won't always be heading in the direction you thought you would! Each player holds an "Emergency Stop" card that they may tactically play only once per round to avoid such a situation.

Whoever first reaches the warp gate wins, but if no one has escaped after six rounds, then the player who is closest to the gate wins.

Gravwell: 2nd Edition features the same gameplay as earlier editions of the game, but now 40 fuel cards are included, which allows up to six players in the game at the same time. (Earlier editions maxed out at four players.) Additionally, ship ability cards are included that can give a unique power to each ship's captain trying to find their way home.

boardgame.description:
July 2021 episode for The Final Light-Year.

This kit adds a new map, new enemies and new parts, but instead of a new boss, the kit brings a Spaceport postcard for campaign play.

You'll place the spaceport between two sector maps and play two full games, with a little extra trouble in-between. The enemies and boss at the second sector are boosted, but you can use actions in the first sector to weaken them. It's an all new type of balance, looking toward the long game.

Released in the July 2021 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.

boardgame.name: Armored Fist 2
boardgame.description:
Back of box

ARMORED FIST 2 - M1A2 ABRAMS
Introducing the U.S. Military newest main battle tank - the M1A2 Abrams.
From the makers of the best-selling combat sims - F-22 Lightning II and Commanche 3

boardgame.name: Anzhela and the Caged Skulls
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The PCs are seated around one of the inn’s many tables in the common dining room, enjoying their breakfast and planning for the day when Anzhela enters the room.

And then things get weird.

This is a two-sided 8.5" x 11" tri-fold brochure.

boardgame.name: The Living Statue of Alk Baum
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Before her death, the foul wizard Zoya Baum dedicated her life to discovering the secrets of the ancient necromancers. Baum’s work, forever immortalized in a slim volume known only as The Unclean Leporello of the Foul Wizard Baum, included all of those unnatural powers the woman discovered . . . at least, all but one power that was so close to her evil heart that she omitted it from her library, destroying the unclean scroll only moments after her one and only time using it.

Although the power itself is lost forever, the damage inflicted by Zoya Baum’s reading of the scroll is only now coming to light, long after the wizard woman’s death. As is appropriate, it is the player characters – the reported “stars” of our stories – that must contend with the ramifcations of Baum’s reading of the now-destroyed scroll.

The Living Statue of Alk Baum is an encounter that the GM may turn to when it is time to entertain the party and no good ideas are readily available. Use this pamphlet as best fits your needs.

This is a two-sided 8.5" x 11" tri-fold brochure.

boardgame.name: Inuyasha: Fūun Emaki
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Inuyasha: Fūun Emaki is a video game where you play as Maitreya.

boardgame.name: A Wizard's Dying Wish
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The wizard Leonhard Brauer is dying.

Of this there can be no doubt.

Brauer is an ancient man, older than he looks. He is fading fast as the cosmic energies that fueled the final years of his life ooze from his wounds, taking on a tangible form and collecting beneath his fallen body in a glistening blue pool of arcane pus.

Although he is dying when the PCs come across the man, Brauer possesses enough strength to make one final request. Will the party take action to fulfill the wizard’s dying wish?

This is a two-sided 8.5" x 11" tri-fold brochure.

boardgame.name: The Broken Sword of Vile Souls
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

When Lorenz Hattendorf was murdered, one member of his party managed to escape the demonic thing and return to the city. Now, Adalet Emre insists that she knows where the man’s magic sword fell when he was torn limb from limb by the monster they encountered.

Emre’s story reaches the ears of Preissner Justus, the wizard who created the sword, and he issues a notice of reward: 100 silver coins to anyone who can bring him the remnants of Hattendorf ’s magic sword.

Soon, the PCs find themselves at the door to an unusual tower deep in the forest.

This is a two-sided 8.5" x 11" tri-fold brochure.

boardgame.name: Wettlauf in den Stall
boardgame.description:
Four farm animals have to reach the stable before sunset and have to cover a distance of 3 fields to do so. In addition, the sun also moves, it has a distance of 8 fields. Whoever's turn it is, rolls the dice and must try to uncover the matching card when an animal is rolled; if you succeed, the animal takes a step and you lay the card out in front of you. For a shamrock rolled, turn over any card and move the animal. If you roll the sun, the animal moves one position. If all animals are in the stable before the sun sets, everyone wins together; the individual winner is the one who has the most animal cards.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Filth Smeared Gnome Issue One: The Postreality Temp. Agency
The Postreality Temp. Agency
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This inaugural issue "The Postreality Temp. Agency" was inspired by the unparalleled cartoon/comic Bee and Puppycat. The premise of surreal temporary employment adventures was just so spectacularly suited to gaming, in addition to being just so conceptually delightful,.

So I took that idea, abstracted my favorite aspects of the show into more malleable game bits, called the result a lens (b/c former Lit. major), and drew a bunch of pictures.

boardgame.name: Pastel Schoolgirls with Magic and Problems
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Y'all were fairly normal, pastel schoolgirls until a few weeks ago. Hobbies, school work, and/or pretty girls/enbies/boys took up the majority of your time.

That's still true, but the amount of time you need to practice your ice powers and confront your dark magic supercharged classmates is definitely growing...

Inspired primarily by Equestria Girls, "Pastel Schoolgirls with Magic and Problems" is a 16 page, hyperlinked, quite colorful supplement for magical girl adventures via the Troika! RPG.

boardgame.name: Psychic Bilgewater Processing Facility
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This issue is a wretchedness necessary to bring the most value to stockholders; however the metaphorical party has been crashed by a Misfits song. It's about a weird refurbishing factory overrun by terror and the living dead. It's also a location based horror adventure for the Troika! RPG.

The psychic bilgewater processing facility was the employer for hundreds of Troika citizens despite being in a private void. They weren't a very good company to work for, but at least they fed the interns, ya know...

Anyway, the last Ferry reported the whole place overrun with Astrozombies so it's probably a bit less safe than when operational. Word on the street, though, is this place usually held huge deposits in souls and coins...

boardgame.name: Der letzte Held (Issue 43 - May 2001)
boardgame.description: contains a scenario that won 3rd place at the Braunschweiger Fantasy Awards (Braunschweiger Schelmin), Havena news, reviews

boardgame.name: Solar Scourge
boardgame.description:
Solar Scourge is a free two or more players sci-fi wargame designed to be simple to play yet strategically challenging.

The game is designed to use 6 mm miniatures.

Set two hundred years in the future.
After a disastrous first contact with the Skyilth the Human Hegemony is desperately trying to defend its remaining contacts from waves of constant attacks.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Gay Crime, Sapphics Against Capital
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The everyday cruelty of petty market lords is a terrible enough thing to combat, but of course the rich assholes have magic too. Clues to the myriad death cults of capital lie nearly naked all around. It's safe to assume most folx with MBAs regularly sacrifice the poor not just as a source for wealth, but for immortality and other preternatural boons.

These are the queer women standing in the rich cultists' way. The time for direct political action is now.

This is a deconstructed zine for use with the Troika! Tabletop Roleplaying Game featuring: 5 Backgrounds and a Modern Fantasy Microsetting, complete with an introductory assassination!

boardgame.name: Walk Away Prosody
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

3 Rebellious Backgrounds for the Troika! RPG written entirely in poetry.

Become a Woman No Longer in Iron Pattens, a Washerwoman Who Walked Away, or a Tradesman Turned Rebel.

Wring lily white necks, Break gentlemen's ankles, and Sow sedition wheresoever your characters may tread!

Featuring a Dramatic Reading of each player character Background by the reclusive author herself.

boardgame.name: Planet Whistletoon
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The whole damn planet waves with a goofy grin as your golden barge descends. The stars serenade you with a saccharine goodbye... Welcome to Planet Whistletoon!

Planet Whistletoon is a pocketmod sized sphere of black & white cartoon antics for the Troika! RPG. Across 8 small pages a world of ceaseless movement and spectacular animism has been sketched.


Discover unusual traders selling even more unusual goods.
Face challenges like rootin' tootin' Mustachioed Gunslingers and Anvil Rain!
Available in both printable pocketmod and screen friendly formats.

boardgame.name: Objects
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Pretend to be a doll made out of knots, love & losss.

Or maybe a disgruntled bathtub.

A full-color digital zine featuring 6 Backgrounds for the Troika! RPG. 16 pages, fully hyperlinked .pdf for quick navigation.

boardgame.name: Der letzte Held (Issue 37 - Oct 1997)
boardgame.description: short fiction, a solo adventure, a scenario, details about Havena, reviews

boardgame.name: Cyber Explosions
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

broken things are beautiful. it's important to understand that when everything is so fundamentally broken. don't mind the glitches, make them something beautiful, and stupid. the error message is from a problem that never was.

ANYWAY, this is a cyberpunk setting for the Troika! rpg, exploding with cartoonish violence.

tl;dr In this game, you kill rich people and take their things.


6 backgrounds from Meme-Kween to 2/3 Cyborg.
A procedure for weaponising social media manipulation.


"Bullshit" Grade Cybernetics

3 suggested jobs, and by jobs I mean violent crimes for your characters to commit.
lots of pictures, many colors, conveniently hyperlinked, conveniently booklet sized pdf
fog · neon · dense stacks of shitty tenements · old trees . Molotov cocktails · blue bloods bleeding fucking red

boardgame.description:
neue Klasse: Der Medikus
neue Abenteuer:
* Das Königreich des Wurms
* Killerinsekten aus dem Weltall
Götter & Patrone (Anansi; Schwarmbewusstsein)
Interview mit Reverend Dak J. Ultimak
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Platformer
boardgame.description:
Plaformer is 2-4 player miniature Board Game introducing light, competitive gameplay that you have never seen before! Climb on platforms, fight monsters, gather gold / points / items and most importantly - race with your friends! This Board Game brings light, extremely FUN experience for family and friends - prepare for tons of laughs and cunning against your opponents!

Platformer is centered around a very simple Gravity Mechanic. During your turn, you climb up – but when your turn ends, you fall down, until you hit a platform or a ladder. Race to the top and try to keep with your opponents!

There’s no one big map in the box. From the cards, you create a new map in every single game. Also, the map has many levels and from the start, you see only one of them.

Every move you may make is determined by the dice. After rolling it you see how many and what moves you can do. You don’t enjoy your result? Don’t worry! Each die may be rerolled once! Back to the actions, it might be a jump, move one space, getting a gold coin, and moving or attacking the monsters. In general, you do not only have to play smart but a little luck is needed too!

boardgame.name: Armored Fist 3
boardgame.description:
Back of box

ROLLING THUNDER ON THE HORIZON
Welcome to the front lines, where you drove to work in 70 tons of fire-breathing steel. Take command, fight smart - and bring your soldiers back alive.

SUPPORT THE TROOPS - Defend your foot soldiers - and yourself - from enemy infantry, artillery strikes and air attacks.

VOXEL SPACE 32 - Next generative graphichs engine supports 16 million colors for unprecedemted detail

CORDINATE AND DEPLOY - Lay down the law with a platoon - or even a company - of M1A2 Anrams tank, and make it stick air support and artilery strikes.

TEST YOURSELF - A full-featured Mission Editior lets you create your own battles for the ultimate challange.

boardgame.name: TWO FREAKIN SWORDS
boardgame.description:
TWO FREAKIN SWORDS is a card game with deck construction, role playing elements (with characters carrying over between games and perma-death), and a rock-paper-scissors mechanism. Players create characters, customize decks of 40 cards, and go back and forth against opponents in 1 vs 1 games, 3+ player rumbles, and 4+ player team games.

Each deck comes with 10 cards of 4 different types:
Defending/Block
Defending/Parry
Attacking/Strike
Attacking/Fake

Before the game, players must fill out a character sheet if they haven't already. They can then customize and organize their decks, keeping the number of cards in the deck at 40 and a minimum of 8 of each type of card. If not everyone has a custom deck, players must instead draw cards from a single pile of 80 cards (two standard decks shuffled together).

All players then place an aggression coin by their right arm and draw 4 cards from their (or the community's) deck. Players then place the card they want to play with the indicator side (Defending/Attacking) facing up. They then decide what they want to do in response to their opponent(s) cards. Once everyone has their cards down, players flip their cards over and compare each hand independently (Player A's right hand vs Player B's and vice versa).

The goal is to get enough hits on your opponent to knock them out of the game (a new character can take 5 hits before dying), tearing up their character sheet in the process and (if you win) adding +1 hit point to your character for the next game you play. The game ends when the last player (or team, in a team game) is left standing.

boardgame.name: Vaults of Vaarn (Issue 1 - Oct 2020)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The sun is dying and the wreckage of countless eons litters the parched wastes of Vaarn, the desolate country that common folk call the blue ruin. It is said that these sky-coloured sands hide the graves of the Autarchs; have swallowed the buried arcologies in which the true seed of humankind was preserved through the Great Collapse; conceal forgotten crypts of memory, decaying crystalline lattices of ancient ego-engines upon which the dusk-blue dunes encroach without pity. From the New Hegemony to the south come drifters and dreamers, desecraters of the tech-tombs that lie sunken beneath the azure wastes. Light-years overhead, aurum-hulled craft ply their tender routes between the spheres, and miles below a pilgrim’s feet, strange wombs are kindled once more with life undreamed of.

These are the hinterlands, where humanity’s great works have fallen to everlasting decay, where machine and animal and fungus think to crown themselves our equal. The phthalo-sands, where newbeasts hunt proudly with boots upon their hind paws and chromepriests chant unending binary devotions to their nameless synthetic god. Only the desperate or the mad would seek to make a life here, to roam the blue desert in search of the secret VAULTS OF VAARN.

boardgame.name: Jenga: Harry Potter
boardgame.description:
It’s time for class at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, but before your lessons can begin, you've got to make it through the arched doors at the top of the school's grand staircase. Will you make it before the stairs fall away from underneath your unpredictable path?

Let the ever-changing staircase in Jenga: Harry Potter put your dexterous skills to the test by carefully removing and replacing blocks towards the door at the top of the tower. Represent your favorite Hogwarts house by choosing one of four color-coded markers representing Gryffindor, Hufflepuff, Slytherin, and Ravenclaw and prepare to make your way to the top. A custom die determines how many blocks to pull and stack as well as the number of stairs you can move your house marker. Watch your steps! If the tower comes crashing down, you'll be late for class and have to rebuild. The first student to reach the top wins and will bring glory to their Hogwarts house.

boardgame.name: Vaults of Vaarn (Issue 2 - Feb 2021)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

When a traveller is adrift in the blue dunes of Vaarn’s desert, he dreams of a city. When the camel’s hump sways beneath him, he dreams of a cushioned alcove in a tavern, with learned conversation and hookah smoke coiling languidly in the air; when Vaarn’s red sun beats upon his head he dreams of cool avenues shaded by demure and welcoming lemon trees. Oppressed by his loneliness, the traveller dreams of a city where the crowds embrace him and strangers greet him as brother; when he swills the last dregs of water around blistered gums he dreams of a a fountain in a public courtyard, where the daughters of the neighbourhood arrive to draw water and eye a handsome stranger.

Gnomon, the city of shaded markets, at first appears to be this dream made solid. There are taverns with cushioned alcoves, as the traveller sought; also he will find learned conversation and hookah smoke, wide avenues flanked by lemon trees, public fountains and smiling maidens and strangers who greet him as brother. There are many sights in Gnomon, sights beyond the traveller’s dreams: glittering mezzanine gardens and parades of masked hierophants, guild halls where cone-hatted clerks ponder their ledgers of debt, babbling souks where the merchants mutter their bargains like mantras and even memories may be bought for the right price. Truly this was what he sought in a city.

So bewitched is our traveller, he scarcely notices that the merchants’ smiles do not reach their eyes, that the women who wave from passion-house windows have faces brittle as porcelain, that each stranger calling him brother has an accomplice reaching into his pocket. It is only as he leaves under cover of darkness, with a head ringing from cheap wine and a purse empty as his stomach, that the traveller begins to curse Gnomon, the undreamed-of city, the gilded trap.

boardgame.name: Vaults of Vaarn (Issue 3 - May 2021)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Vaarn! I curse each letter of the name.

I curse the blue sand that infiltrates every pore of my body, the creeping sand, which each night swallows a little more of the final camp we have erected upon the face of this pitiless azure desolation. I curse the red sun that rises each morning to scorch the skin from our scalps; that great and gory globe, which the sages tell us is dying, yet seems to me, hanging above the lapis wastelands, to be full of malevolent life.

Vaarn! I curse you! I curse this land that has stolen the tears from its peoples’ eyes, this land that swallows armies and poets and aeons as if they all, every work of every man, were but one more grain of mazarine sand. Vaarn! Three times I curse you, for I fear I will see no other land again.


- Final testament of Idris Ida-Null, Hegemony Cartographer.

boardgame.name: Lords of Ragnarok
boardgame.description:
In this 1-4 player strategic board game, you will lead a unique, asymmetric hero and their army, trying to be the ultimate victor in a war that unfolds over approximately 120 minutes. Players will choose from various actions, such as building monuments, hunting monsters, ravaging the lands, gathering armies and artifacts.
Gods will grant you blessings that will heavily impact the game and create a unique combo for each player. On top of all that, special runes will play a significant role in leveling up your armies or earning other bonuses that include control of deadly monsters.

While the game is spiritual successor of Lords of Hellas and implements a lot of core gameplay aspects, there will be a lot of new mechanics and twists, so prepare yourself for fresh, new thematic experience!

Multiple victory conditions will keep players at the edge of their seats until the end of the game, making room for some stunning, carefully planned last-minute reversals!

New. PREORDER. Core Pledge
No returns unless KS cancels. Long delays are common with KS.

New PREORDER Mythic pledge (core pledge plus art book, terrain pack, enhanced runes) in Sundrop
Final sale no refunds. Expect long delays from KS.

boardgame.name: Looking Glass: Saigon 1968
Saigon: 1968
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Saigon, 1968: Vietnam’s “Paris of the East” is a hotbed of conflict and intrigue, from the CIA and the Viet Cong to Buddhist monks and Western media. Looking Glass: Saigon 1968 gives you a view into all this, as well as the city’s shadowy underworld of vampires, conspiracies, and the Mythos. This tight city supplement equips GUMSHOE GMs with just enough evocative detail and intriguing possibilities to bring Saigon to life for their players.

A foundation and framework, Looking Glass: Saigon 1968 can launch you into immediate play or provide pointers for your own researches. With these ingredients, you can begin cooking Saigon as a “Low and Slow” 1968 city setting for your GUMSHOE game—not just The Fall of DELTA GREEN, but also Trail of Cthulhu, Night’s Black Agents, TimeWatch, and others.

Looking Glass: Saigon 1968 features:


The lay of the land, where crowds gather and how your heroes arrive.
Three unique backdrops: the Rex Hotel, the Saigon Zoo, and the Le Van Duyet Tomb
Seven Saigon story seeds and hooks.
The Mythos in Saigon.

boardgame.name: The Dragon's Hoard (Issue #7 - Jun 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Magic, Monsters, and More!
The Dragon’s Hoard is a monthly anthology of magic items, spells, monsters, and more for your 5th Edition campaign! Each issue of The Dragon’s Hoard takes every new magic item, spell, monster, or other new rules content from our ongoing Legendary Loot Patreon and presents it for you, with dozens of new elements beautifully illustrated and ready to unleash on your players! In this month's features you'll find:
• The Treasure Trove, featuring magnificent magic items like the scroll of passage, fanged warclub, glitterfrost buckler, and rod of shadow puppetry!
• Basker’s Books, featuring new spells for almost every 5E spellcaster like spirit trance, creeping shadow, drowsy fireflies, and hurricane!
• Class Acts, featuring new class options for your 5E heroes like the Voyager, College of Reliquaries, and Cultist of the Dead God!
• Marvelous Monsters, featuring killer creatures across every challenge level like the mist drake, lusca, and the faithful xolo guardian!

boardgame.name: Cleric Domain: Commerce Domain
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Beyond the simple exchange of coin for goods and services, a cleric of the Commerce domain introduces a presence of security into a transaction. These clerics are not typically swayed by personal interest in the exchange, making them highly valued, but often the prices for their services as mediators, agents, or brokers will reflect it.

Building off of the existing Fifth Edition rules to build a cleric character, the Commerce Domain gives you options to build a mercantile cleric, protecting lawful exchanges and preserving trust and societal structure across the mortal realm.

boardgame.name: Voodolls
Voodolls - The Retribution Of Hell
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





You are the soul of a banished wizard, trying to make your way out of hell.User Summary

boardgame.name: Prison Architect: Second Changes
boardgame.description:
Prison Architect: Second Chances gives your inmates a fresh start with reform and rehabilitation features, helping them improve behaviors and reduce sentences.

Key Features

Return to Reform
New programs, such as Animal Therapy, Meetings with civilians, and Conflict Resolution classes led by former prisoners can remove an inmate's negative traits and see improved behaviors.

Good Behavior
Inmates can have their sentences reduced or increased based on their actions and reoffenders can now be sent back to prison. Players will be rewarded for each rehabilitated inmate and fined for each reoffender.

Room for Improvement
Inmates with existing or earned work credentials can become vendors to both prisoners and visitors in inmate-run rooms, including a Bakery and Restaurant.

Back to Society
Inmates can earn work experience by partaking in different work and training programs.

Source: The Game Website.
boardgame.videogameversion: Live Xbox One/ X downloadable edition

boardgame.name: Criminal and Chivatos
boardgame.description:
Murder has occurred! The victim is inspected by a medical examiner while the National Police are called to the crime scene. The police do not know that the Criminal and the Guaremate "accomplice" is among them.

Someone saw the Criminal and the Guaremate at the crime scene. There is a snitch. You and your teammate must work together to reveal the identity of the imposters.

The theme of the game is about investigators and assassins. Where the murderers pose as police but there is a person who knows who the real criminals are.

The game is set in the daily life of the Dominican Republic. Where the weapons have names that the locals assign to them. The game has a heavy jargon used by the Dominicans.

There is a medical examiner who is on the side of the investigators and who can give clues to the investigators. The medical examiner can mark, in a folder, the state of the body, how hard the blow was, where the body suffered the attack, how quickly it died, what was the cause of death.

A player can accuse another player by selecting the weapon and place that the player think are correct. If the player fail then he lost he badge (and cannot accuse any other player).

The game can end in two ways, the first way is after three turns of accusation have passed. Second way is when Investigators find the weapon and the place where the murder occurred.

There are two teams, the team of police officers and investigators and the team of the murderer, his accomplice. The team of investigators wins if they find the weapon and the location of the murder. The teams of the murderer and accomplice win if after three rounds of accusations the investigator does not find the weapon and the place. Another winning condition for the killer team is if the killer finds out who the snitch is.

boardgame.name: Don't Steal My Cow, Man!
boardgame.description:
Beef loving invasive aliens have landed and circled your farm with crop circles! Marking it as a landing site for an all you can eat beef buffet!!

One team controls the farmers and one controls the aliens! Farmers seek to wrangle their cows back into the barn and put a few pieces of buckshot in the unknown cow thieves. Meanwhile the aliens seek to capture the cows, mind control pesky farmers and lead the cows back to their UFOs!

Whoever gets 4 cows first, wins.

NOW ON KICKSTARTER!

boardgame.name: Dice Lords: A Collectible Trading Dice Game
boardgame.description:
A blown up version of fantasy chess.

Each player moves and attacks with one creature each turn. Each creature has their own unique stats (health points (HP), movement, and attack) that they use to deal damage to the opponent's creatures. When a creature receives damage, that creature will turn down to the face with the appropriate HP showing. Once a die is defeated, the player that defeated the die places it in the scoring area until the end of the game, where they would then roll to find out who won.

boardgame.name: Hostile Environment: Walk Solobot AI
boardgame.description:
This is an Artificial Intelligence system deck to order enemy units around in Walk, so you may play solo or co-op against the enemy.

The rules work through a deck of 40 cards that tell enemy units, where to go and what to do.

There are three sets of instructions on every card. One set gives orders to patrolling units unaware of the player. The other two sets of orders are for aware units attacking the player's units, separated by the size of the Walks (Light/Reg Vs Large/Behemoth).

Patrol instructions include: Sweeping the area for the player, Patrolling objectives, Checking suspicious behavior, etc...

Attack instructions include: Rushing the player, Flanking, Various types of attacks, etc...

Each card includes: Compass directions, Dice rolls, Player to attack, and Hit Locations. There are also playing card symbols on each card to be used for variable actions or objective orders in the case of multiple objectives.

For each enemy activation, the player draws a card for that enemy unit. The card gives the enemy order or orders, sometimes requiring multiple cards to be drawn to show what direction the enemy moves, and also which player to attack.

H.E.: Walk Solobot AI is quick to learn and gives you a good fight. The enemy might just surprise you!
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Hostile Environment: Walk – Mech Skirmish Rules

boardgame.name: Dune: Game Mat
boardgame.description:
"Conquer Arrakis with this deluxe collectors game mat for Dune, A Game of Conquest, Diplomacy & Betrayal. Scaled up 135% for maximum visibility, the Dune Game Mat is accompanied by Sandworm, Storm & Family Atomics special edition miniatures."

The mat is made of vinyl and is 24in x 36in.

listing.notes: weight: 375 grams + packaging

Brand new.
Shipping to EU would be 15 euro and the package should arrive in 7-10 days. Elsewhere – please ask!
Check out my other products for sale as well! If you buy multiple items, I will combine shipping costs. It’s much cheaper this way.

boardgame.name: Wayward Fey
boardgame.description:
"The Feywild is a perilous land filled with hags and fomorians, but also with playful pixies and benevolent unicorns.

Join to these ranks the dutiful Silver Knight, the playful Streamling or the majesty of the Grandmother Dryad.

This supplement provides you with advice, statistics, recommended treasure and useful background and flavor notes for using six new kinds of fey in your game. The creatures in this work range from the benevolent Chime to the ravenous Dream Eater and will provide you with new and provocative options for your game.

Also included are options for lateral advancement of player characters with a fey theme and a variant Archfey patron for Warlocks."

(Author Summary)

boardgame.name: 44 BCE
boardgame.description:
On the Ides of March 44 BCE; Julius Caesar was assassinated. In the power vacuum, you vie for control of the Roman Republic. With no clear leader in place, the Senate awards Imperium Maius to one of your rivals. You must scheme, conspire and backstab to increase your Imperium. The Senate will observe the shifts in power and grant Imperium Maius to the most powerful leader. At last, the Senate will be forced to concede, one leader has an insurmountable amount of Imperium! The Roman Empire will be born and a new Caesar will be crowned! Will it be you?

44 BCE is a rotating all-on-one strategy game for 2-5 players aged 14 and up.

In this dramatic, emotion provoked, immersive gameplay, you are one of five suitors, Agrippa, Brutus, Cleopatra, Mark Antony, or Octavian, competing to become the first Emperor of Rome. Each year the Imperium Maius will compete against the Suitors to maintain control of the republic.

To succeed, you must collaborate with the other suitors but remain on the lookout for every opportunity to gain an advantage over your fellow competitors and slash them down. If you succeed, the Senate will declare you Imperium Maius for the next year.

After clashing it out over six years (rounds), the player with the most Imperium will be anointed the first Roman Emperor!

boardgame.name: MechaForce: Tactical Combat Game
boardgame.description:
The streamlined tactical combat game of giant armored mecha.

The MechaForce rulebook is a very concise and streamlined 7 pages and gives you details on Mecha Construction, Pilot Advancement, Movement, Firing, Brawling, Conventional Forces, and more.
To play the game you will need tokens and a map with a hexagonal grid.
You may alternately play with miniatures and model terrain.

This purchase includes both a PDF version suitable for reading on your computer, iPad or iPhone and a special 'PocketMod' PDF version for printing.
The PocketMod version lets you create your own 4.25" x 2.75" sized game books from a single sheet of paper.
Take a copy to read on the go, and print one to give to each player at the table.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Hype Tag
boardgame.description:
Return to the nostalgic (and sometimes painful) schoolyards of youth to battle it out at recess in a cutthroat game of tag.
Hype Tag is an innovative, addictively re-playable strategy card game for 2-4 hipsters ages 13 and up.

To win, be the first player to get up to 10 on your hype meter, flip it over, and then go back down to 1. You gotta GET HYPED by making impressive tags and creating mischief on the playground... but then you need to have enough self-control to SIMMER DOWN and go back to class!

Hype Tag features the unique interaction of two different decks of cards. The HYPE deck has the strategic depth of a trading card game while the TAG deck has the simple fun of a classic card game. It's like if Magic and Uno had a baby.

A unique aspect of Hype Tag is the hype mechanic. Each HYPE card has a number in the upper corner and you must at that number (or higher) on your hype meter to play the card. Many cards also have a bonus, granting an even more powerful effect the higher you get. But... when you flip your meter over and start moving back down, your dwindling hype prevents you from getting bonuses and eventually makes some hype cards unplayable. So you have to be crafty and a little bit cutthroat to win. The game ends when the first player gets back down to 1.

Be sure to manage your hand carefully because you have to play a tag card to tag an an opponent at the end of each turn. If you can't, you have to call a time out which rewards the other players. In 3 and 4 player games, Hype Tag has a unique non-standard turn order which gives players a choice about who to tag. And this choice carries strategic implications.

The game also include "Sass" cards that block and copy the actions of others, trait bonuses that reward certain styles of play, and Older Kids - special character cards you receive when you reach 10 on your hype meter - that grant powerful abilities aiding your descent back down to 1.

It is great casual fun that also stands up to very intense tournament style play.

boardgame.name: Photographic World
boardgame.description:
Travel to the ocean to hunt for the best photograph of the great white shark. Head over to Australia to snap a fantastic photo of a kangaroo and her joey. Continue on the Asia to see a royal Bengal tiger. Will you become the Wildlife Photographer of the Year?

In Photographic World, you are wildlife photographers. Your job is to travel the world, capturing exceptional photos of animals in their natural habitats. Every unique photo you take increases your fame and renown.

On their turn, a player rolls the dice. If they roll a 1, they move 1 space on the board. Rolling two 1’s triggers the travel rule and let’s you move to any space on the board and take a picture there (draw a card from that continents deck). If you roll a camera, take a picture. If you roll a shopping cart, buy from or sell to the Market. If you roll a question mark, decide if you want it to be a 1, and camera, or a shopping cart.

The game ends when all the Best in Class certificates are gone. You earn these by collecting photos of 3 unique animals in the class depicted on the certificates. There are 6 Best in Class certificates to be awarded. For a shorter game, play until 3 certificates have been taken.

The player with the most fame points wins. Fame points are acquired through collecting unique photos of animals, collecting Best in Class certificates, and winning Bonus Award cards (based on having the most unique animals in each continent).

boardgame.name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Teamwork and Event Cards
boardgame.description:
These cards spice up your games of The Walking Dead: All Out War by adding new faction-specific events and introducing exciting gameplay options with different combinations of survivors.

Contents:

Pack of Cards (34 Team Cards and 7 Event Cards)
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: The Walking Dead – All Out War
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: The Walking Dead: All Out War
The Walking Dead: All Out War Collector's Edition

boardgame.name: Lingolandia
boardgame.description:
Lingolandia is a family game that fosters creativity, vocabullary and you can play it in various languages!

In Lingolandia, you draw a random letter from the bag and roll the dice to determine what kind of round this will be. There are two different types - player's own round or crazy joined round where all players play together.

Then players need to find words on displayed cards where you can use your imagination as well as observation.

Rules make sure that players are always involved even in the own turn of another player.

Each card provides various interpretation while they have also enough visual objects to allow just enough options also for players which focus more on searching and observing the illustrations.

Players take turns where each player take one random letter from the bag and then roll the die. Dice will determine if they are going to play individual round or joined round where all palyers guess the words simultaneously.

So base on the die roll if there is a number (2-5) this will be the number of words that player has to find on the face up cards around the board (16 cards with various ilustrations). Words has to start with the selected letter and they can be present on the cards but players can also use their imagination.

If the die roll shows a balloon (Lingolandia logo) then all players are guessing the words at the same time - very interactive round.

Correctly guessed words are turned into points which are counted on the board (road to the finish line) and first player that gather enough points to cross the finish line is the winner.

boardgame.name: The Lion's Court
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Secrets, bribes, blackmail... In The Lion's Court everyone is a suspect and no one is telling the entire truth. This tiny business card role-playing game follows a tense trial as 3-6 conniving critters fling accusations, reveal secrets, and concoct elaborate alibis until one confesses and begs for leniency.

boardgame.name: Five Gems
boardgame.description:
Five Gems is designed to be a fun economic PnP game that can be played by adults and children.
There are 5 gems all worth different values in the market: ruby, sapphire, emerald, topaz, and diamond.
Players must Trade Up and purchase gems from their starting 2 cards to build a stockpile of gems.
It's a game that can be played multiple times to learn which gems are more valuable, which cards to keep and which to trade away.

The player who earns the most types of gems over the determined number of rounds is the winner.

How to Play:
Exchange phase:
Each player starts off with a very small collection of gems on their cards.
The start player rolls the 3 dice, then from the trade marker the dice are placed around the board counting away from the trade marker.
The start player sets the market by choosing one of the exchange rates. Everyone trades 1 of their cards by following the exchange rates in that segment trying to collect more sets of a gem type.
When they trade their card they draw a number of new unrevealed cards as stated by the exchange rate and add them to their collection. The next player then becomes the start player, and continues over several rounds.

Purchase phase:
Players that have collected a certain amount of coins on their cards can buy some extra cards hoping to get more gems.

Scoring:
Count up all the gems on the cards for each type. Whomever has the most majority of each Type is the winner.
Rings on cards will break ties.
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: popipopo games (ぽぴぽぽゲームズ)
